snippet: In Brooklyn, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said the strategy has helped reduce crime but acknowledged that the police should treat people being stopped with greater respect.
abstract: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg takes the pulpit before a black congregation in Brooklyn to address the New York City Police Department's controversial stop-and-frisk policy; argues that the practice helps make the city safe, but acknowledges that the police should treat people stopped with greater respect; critics of the policy say it unfairly targets black and Hispanic young men.
lead_paragraph: In Brooklyn, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said the strategy has helped reduce crime but acknowledged that the police should treat people being stopped with greater respect.

headline.seo: At Brooklyn Church, Bloomberg Defends Stop-and-Frisk Policy
headline.main: Stop-and-Frisk Policy ‘Saves Lives,’ Mayor Tells Black Congregation
headline.print_headline: Stop-and-Frisk Policy ‘Saves Lives,’ Mayor Tells Black Congregation
